task_summary: Detect the white box, approach, grasp securely, and hold it steadily for a short duration.

task_long_description.overview: A table-top arm must pick and hold a white box. The scene shows several small objects (orange blocks, a pink prism, green bottle, small can) arranged on a white table under a UR-style manipulator. The goal is not to move or place the object, but to establish a reliable grasp and maintain the hold briefly. The plan uses perception, alignment, a top grasp, and a stability check before holding for a fixed time.
preconditions: Robot is homed with reachable workspace over the table
White box is on the table and visible after a short scan
No obstacles prevent a vertical top grasp
stepwise_plan: Scan and detect the white box.
Move to a safe pre-grasp height above the target.
Open gripper and align to the object with tight tolerance.
Compute a top grasp pose and execute the grasp motion.
Close the gripper with moderate force and verify grasp stability.
Hold the object in place for the required duration.
success_criteria: Object is detected and reached without collisions
Gripper closes on the object and ObjectInGripper would be true (proxied by stability check)
HoldObject runs for the configured duration without slip
failure_and_recovery: Perception miss: re-run scan/detect and adjust view if needed
Misalignment: re-run ApproachAndAlign with fresh pose
Weak grasp: reopen, recompute grasp pose, and retry closing
task_long_description.termination: Tree succeeds after HoldObject completes the duration without errors; it fails on any unrecoverable step.

frame_6.now_evidence: Likely moment of grasp execution; end-effector centered above target zone.
frame_6.predicts_next: Immediate gripper closure is expected, leading to stability check.

node_specs.description: Active search for the white box using a spiral pattern.
Detect the white box and cache its pose.
Move to a safe pre-grasp height above the object.
Approach and align to reduce lateral error before grasp.
Compute a top grasp pose and store it to blackboard.
Execute motion to the computed grasp pose.
Maintain the grasp for a fixed duration.

failure_modes: Object not detected due to occlusion or lighting
Insufficient grip force leading to slip
Planner timeout while moving to grasp pose
recovery_strategy: Repeat scan/detection with slight viewpoint change
Re-run alignment and recompute grasp pose
Open gripper and attempt a second grasp with the same top strategy
Abort if repeated planning timeouts occur
assumptions: The contact sheet suggests small tabletop items; the white box is assumed present though its appearance is low-contrast.
Top grasp is feasible; no need to relocate or place the object since the goal is only to hold.
